CS509.client.airport

Class Airports

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Airport>
          • CS509.client.airport.Airports
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Airport>, java.util.Collection<Airport>, java.util.List<Airport>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class Airports
extends java.util.ArrayList<Airport>
    This class aggregates a number of Airport. The aggregate is implemented as an ArrayList. Airports can be added to the aggregate via XML strings in the format returned form the CS509 server, or as Airport objects using the ArrayList interface. Objects can be removed from the collection using the ArrayList interface.
    Author:
    blake
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • addAll

        public boolean addAll(java.lang.String xmlAirports)
               throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Builds collection of airports from airports described in XML Parses an XML string to read each of the airports and adds each valid airport to the collection. The method uses Java DOM (Document Object Model) to convert from XML to Java primitives.
        Parameters:
        xmlAirports - XML string containing set of airports
        Returns:
        true if the collection was modified, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - included to keep signature consistent with other addAll methods

      • buildDomDoc

        private org.w3c.dom.Document buildDomDoc(java.lang.String xmlString)
        Builds a DOM tree form an XML string Parses the XML file and returns a DOM tree that can be processed
        Parameters:
        xmlString - XML String containing set of objects
        Returns:
        DOM tree from parsed XML or null if exception is caught

      • buildAirport

        private Airport buildAirport(org.w3c.dom.Node nodeAirport)
        Creates an Airport object form a DOM node Processes a DOM Node that describes an Airport and creates an Airport object from the information
        Parameters:
        nodeAirport - is a DOM Node describing an Airport
        Returns:
        Airport object created from the DOM Node representation of the Airport

      • getCharacterDataFromElement

        private static java.lang.String getCharacterDataFromElement(org.w3c.dom.Element e)
        Retrieve character data from an element if it exists
        Parameters:
        e - is the DOM Element to retrieve character data from
        Returns:
        the character data as String [possibly empty String]
